page.title: 17FARMING
page.content: The land in and around Broughshane consists of a number of small farms. Many of the farms involve themselves in a mixture of farming comprising dairy, beef,pig,sheep,arable and chicken farming. Many types of farming are carried on in the Broughshane area and no particular type is dominant,although beef and dairy farming are popular.In the case of the dairy farming,the cattle are milked early in the morning and again in the evening.This milk is then stored in tanks and collected by a tanker,which transports it to the dairy at{Dromona},where it is changed into such dairy products as butter and cheese. Other types of farming include arable farming where such crops as potatoes and wheat are grown.Many farms also keep pigs and chickens.
